plan: Given the high-risk strategy, I initially don't regret high bids, as they provide valuable data and may lead to wins. Similarly, low bid regrets are minimized given the exploratory nature of this approach. For my future strategy, I plan to use a varied bidding approach, pursuing both aggressive (bidding within the top 15-25% range) and conservative tactics (bidding in the lower 25%). This will depend on the pattern exhibited by the other bidders and my assigned value. Patterns detected from the bids of Betty and Charles will dictate adjustments in my bidding approach, keeping the end goal of maximizing profit.

If others bid considerably lower, I wouldn't regret my bid, as I'd win the auction at a price that's reasonable to me. If others bid higher, I still wouldn't regret, as I attempted to stay within my comfort range. My plan involves diversifying my bids, starting with smaller bids, then pushing to higher ones, then back to mid-range values. This allows me to gather data about my competitors' bidding style, their risk tolerance, and the likely average winning bid, enabling me to fine-tune my strategy according to the observed patterns and maximize long-term profit.

No, I won't regret my bid in either case, as exploring new strategies, learning and adjusting is the priority. If others bid lower, I will gain valuable data on bidding behavior, and if they bid higher, I will learn about their aggressive approach. I'll also consider bidding aggressively when I have a high value, and conservatively when it's lower.
